summary: This document is the curriculum vitae of Dr. Lisa Marie Rocchio, a licensed clinical psychologist specializing in trauma, forensic assessment, and psychotherapy. It details her extensive education, licensure, clinical experience, research, publications, professional presentations, and leadership roles in psychological associations, particularly focusing on trauma psychology and ethics. This document appears to be pages from a professional resume or CV for Lisa Marie Rocchio, Ph.D., detailing her advocacy work, professional affiliations, and community activities. It lists her congressional visits with Rhode Island politicians to advocate for Medicare and mental health reform, her legislative advocacy in Rhode Island, and her involvement with various psychological associations and community boards. The document does not directly reference Jeffrey Epstein or his case.

keyFacts: Dr. Lisa Marie Rocchio is a licensed clinical psychologist with expertise in trauma, forensic assessment, and the treatment of dissociative disorders.
She is the Clinical Director and Owner of 'Lisa M. Rocchio, Ph.D. & Associates, Inc.', an independent group practice in Johnston, RI.
She holds a Clinical Instructor appointment in the Department of Psychiatry and Human Behavior at the Alpert Medical School of Brown University.
Her professional focus includes forensic consultation, expert testimony, and ethical issues in trauma psychology, with numerous publications and presentations on these topics.
She holds leadership positions in the American Psychological Association, including President-Elect of Division 56 (Trauma Psychology) and member of the APA Ethics Committee.
The document is a professional resume/CV for psychologist Lisa Marie Rocchio, Ph.D., showing no direct connection to Jeffrey Epstein, his associates, or his crimes.

It details Rocchio's extensive advocacy work with the American Psychological Association, including multiple congressional visits to Rhode Island's federal delegation (Reed, Whitehouse, Cicilline, Langevin) between 2012 and 2016.
The document shows Rocchio's involvement in Rhode Island state legislative advocacy from 2004 onward, including service on a special joint commission from 2013-2014.
It lists her professional affiliations with numerous psychological associations focused on trauma, dissociation, and women's issues.
The document notes her community activities, primarily with the Moses Brown School in Providence, RI, where she held various committee and board positions.
